snippet: The superintendent’s tough response to audience members’ exclamations at Senatobia High’s ceremony fueled allegations of overreach and racial bias.
abstract: Mississippi authorities decide to drop misdemeanor charges against three people for cheering during graduation ceremony at Senatobia High School in defiance of request for quiet by Jay Foster, city's schools superintendent.
lead_paragraph: The superintendent’s tough response to audience members’ exclamations at Senatobia High’s ceremony fueled allegations of overreach and racial bias.

headline.main: Mississippi District Won’t Pursue Charges Over Cheers at a High School Graduation
headline.print_headline: Mississippi District Won’t Pursue Charges Over Cheers at a High School Graduation
